p: Some papers evaluated the variation in EO content according to phenological stage. According to Worku and Bertoldi [ 83], who observed the evolution of EO composition from the pre-flowering stage to the immature seed stage, the content of ( Z)-β-ocimene increased through the process from 7.2% to 37.5%, and the content of ( Z)-tagetenone declined from almost 40% to 13.1%, while little difference was observed for ( Z)- and ( E)-tagetone. Chalchat and coworkers [ 84], measuring the same variations, found that the content of ( Z)-β-ocimene increased dramatically from the pre-flowering (2%) to early flowering (20.4%) stage, and then decreased slightly. The content of ( Z)-tagetenone increased from 0.1% to 8.3% at the early flowering stage, and then decreased again. Dihydrotagetone increased from 16.5% to 33.4%, ( E)-tagetone decreased from 16.9% to 3.7%, ( Z)-tagetone remained stable at levels of 18.2–23.4%, and ( E)-tagetenone was stable around 0.2% apart from a peak at the early flowering stage of 2.2%.
